did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Photographs of textile machinery, textile workers, and carpet samples.

scopecontent.p: Consists of photographs of machinery, including the process of getting a ring spinning frame into the mill building. There are also photographs of mill workers operating the machinery, raw wool being delivered, and photographs of carpet samples.

controlaccess.corpname: Little Falls Carpet Mills (Little Falls, N.J.)

did.unittitle: Item 1: Machinery being moved into mill

scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, [195-?]. Image depicts some machinery (probably a ring spinning frame) being moved into a brick mill through a loading dock door. The truck in the foreground has a Virginia license plate. Man walks away in the left foreground. See Item 2 in this folder for a better image of the machinery. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. 25.75 x 20.25 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 2: Ring spinning frame being moved into mill

scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, [195-?]. Image depicts a ring spinning frame being moved into a brick mill through a loading dock door. Two workmen are visible. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. 25.75 x 20.5 cm. See Item 5 in this folder for a view of the entire frame once it was moved indoors.

did.unittitle: Item 3: Ring spinning frame on truck

scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, [195-?]. Image depicts a ring spinning frame on a truck owned by D. Graham, Phila., Pa. The frame was being moved into the Beattie Manufacturing Company of Little Falls, N.J. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. 25.75 x 20.5 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 4: Ring spinning frame on truck

scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, [195-?]. Image depicts a ring spinning frame on a truck owned by D. Graham, Phila., Pa. The frame was being moved into the Beattie Manufacturing Company of Little Falls, N.J. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. Copy B. 25.75 x 20.5 cm.

Gelatin silver print, [195-?]. Image depicts a ring spinning frame after it had been moved from a truck to an indoor location at Beattie Manufacturing. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. 25.75 x 20.5 cm. See Item 2 in this folder for an image of the machinery being moved into the building.
3 color images, 8x10; 2 black and white images, 8x10

Gelatin silver print, [1945-50?]. Image depicts a woolen condenser card, which is a wool card with a tape condenser on the delivery end. The tape condenser splits the doffer web into numerous narrow strips, condenses them into ropings and winds them on a jack spool. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. 25.5 x 20.75 cm.

Gelatin silver print, [195-?]. Image depicts a twister in the interior of Beattie Manufacturing. A twister twists together two or more separate ends, making either a ply yarn or a cable yarn. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. 25.75 x 20.5 cm.
16 images, 8x10; 11 images, 4x5. Nine images of a man posing with carpets, fourteen images of carpet samples, and three miscellaneous images.
3 black and white images, 8x10; 1 color image, 8x10; 1 black and white image (Polaroid), 4x5; 2 color images, 3x4 (Polaroid)

Color Poloraid photograph, [1965-75?]. Image depicts a frame holding about 10 different carpet samples. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. See Item 2 in this folder for a better photograph of the same carpet samples. 8.5 x 10.75 cm.
Color Poloraid photograph, [1965-75?]. Image depicts a frame holding about 10 different carpet samples. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. 8.5 x 10.75 cm.
Black-and-white Poloraid photograph, [1965-75?]. Image depicts a standing frame holding eight carpet samples. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. 8.25 x 9 cm.
Gelatin silver print, [1965-75?]. Image depicts one carpet pattern; "Volaree 6900" written on bottom margin. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. 20.5 x 25.5 cm.
Gelatin silver print, [1965-75?]. Image depicts one carpet pattern; "Marco Polo 3080" written on bottom margin. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. 20.5 x 25.5 cm.
Gelatin silver print, [1965-75?]. Image depicts one carpet pattern; "Scottsdale 3600" written in upper right-hand margin. The Beattie Manufacturing Company made carpets. 20.5 x 25.5 cm.
